main event: Captain Robert S. Gleason observed two white objects in the sky traveling at a high rate of speed on 4 February 1953.
interesting points: The first object appeared overhead and altered its course to the north-west before disappearing over the horizon., A second object appeared approximately one minute later and followed a similar path., Both objects were observed for about 15 seconds., The sightings occurred under clear weather conditions with unlimited visibility., The event was confirmed by 1st Lt. Joseph A. Pichler and 1st Lt. Lawrence H. Duval Jr.
sighted object: two white objects traveling at high speed
witness description: Captain Robert S. Gleason, 1st Lt. Joseph A. Pichler, 1st Lt. Lawrence H. Duval Jr.
